content: Great, but it's hard to turn the way your units face. Idk how to do it if it's possible.
replyContent:
Please see the following link for a guide on changing a unit's formation or depth in the 'Groups and Formations' section:

http://www.feralinteractive.com/en/games/rometw-ios/help/

You will need to hold your fingers down for a couple of seconds until the purple circles appear under the desired unit, you can then alter that unit's formation.

Another master piece but the only problem is the custom formation, when I form them up to my formation and move to meet the enemy sometimes ( not all ) they reset to single line which also in the heat of battle is costly the whole formation collapses please fix

Worst Dlc ever ported and a waste of money. The controls skip all over the board, the camera is in a fixed above view mode, and the campaign is limited to one faction and at that the units are the worst I have ever experienced.

The addon is a nice concept, but it is a little unplayable for me. If I touch the screen, i skip all the way across the map and it is almost impossible to play sometimes. I paid $5 for an addon where I can only play as one faction and I cant even play that because the controls are extremely sensitive and they cant be adjusted. In the main game and Barbarian expansion, the game plays just fine. Maybe this one needs a controls update to fix sensitivity.

content: Awesome aha I find it to be playing total war without using a pc, like the controls n whatnot are easy to get around just pay attention to the advisor in tutorial n you'll be right.

I played all the Rome total war games when they first came out on PC 20 years ago. They were my favorite war game to play then and now they are again. Almost all of the functionality that was available on the PC versions are available on the mobile apps and I am hooked again. Thank you so much to the developers that took the time and coverted these all time favorites over so that I may enjoy them again!

Yet again, another wonderful port from the Total War Series. ROME: Total War - Alexander's campaign uses the Macedon faction, which is the same as the original computer version of the game. Three other factions are available in Custom Battle Mode.

If there's anything else you wish to discuss, please contact us directly via support@feralinteractive.com

content: Another TW port from Feral and another instant buy for me. Guys, you are great - please keep doing what you are doing! While this expansion might not be as feature rich as the original Rome TW or BI expansion, it is still worth playing and is a fresh experience for a seasoned TW player. If you never played a Rome TW game before, I would suggest that you leave Alexander alone for now and then come back later to be able to fully appreciate it!
Really love it
